topic.title: [T] Basic Discussion - Introduce Yourself
topic.text:
An introduction discussion is useful way to initially engage with students and begin to establish some connection, particularly for remote courses (synch. or async.) Suggested text might include...

By now you've had the chance to get to know a bit about me from the course welcome video. I'd like to get to know all of you as well so that I can begin to learn more about how I can serve your goals and interests.

Please take a few minutes to introduce yourself to the class. Some things you might want to share may include:

  • Where in the world are you? Since this is an online class, you might be in an exotic, far-flung location! Please share!
  • What interests you about this class or degree?
  • What's your professional background? Will this help your career?
  • What do you like to do for fun?
  • If you were in a room with your classmates, what board game would you ask them to play?

In other words, tell me something about you as a unique and special human being that lets us know the real you andÂ  brings us all closer as a community!
